title: Parag Patel
text:
Parag Patel <a href="Fellowship%20of%20the%20Royal%20College%20of%20Surgeons">FRCS</a> (born 27 December 1975) is a British <a href="Sport%20shooting">sport shooter</a> who works as an <a href="Otolaryngology">ear, nose and throat</a> consultant at <a href="Kingston%20Hospital%20NHS%20Foundation%20Trust">Kingston Hospital</a> in London.
Patel competed for England in the <a href="Shooting%20at%20the%202014%20Commonwealth%20Games%20%E2%80%93%20Queen%27s%20prize%20pairs">Queen's prize pairs</a> and <a href="Shooting%20at%20the%202014%20Commonwealth%20Games%20%E2%80%93%20Queen%27s%20prize%20individual">individual</a> events at the <a href="2014%20Commonwealth%20Games">2014 Commonwealth Games</a> where he won a gold and bronze medal respectively. He had previously won two golds, a silver and a bronze in the full bore rifle events at the two preceding Commonwealth Games.
On 22 July 2017, Patel won the prestigious Gold Medal in the third stage of the Queen's Prize competition during the National Rifle Association's 148th Imperial Meeting, held at Bisley Camp in Surrey, England.
Patel started shooting at <a href="Epsom%20College">Epsom College</a> and his prodigious talent was in early evidence as he won the Canadian Grand Aggregate as an <a href="British%20Cadet%20Rifle%20Team">Atheling</a> in 1994.
